Title: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
FullTitle: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (2005)
Plot: Harry's (Daniel Radcliffe's) fourth year at Hogwarts is about to start and he is enjoying the summer vacation with his friends. They get the tickets to The Quidditch World Cup Final, but after the match is over, people dressed like Lord Voldemort's (Ralph Fiennes') "Death Eaters" set a fire to all of the visitors' tents, coupled with the appearance of Voldemort's symbol, the "Dark Mark" in the sky, which causes a frenzy across the magical community. That same year, Hogwarts is hosting "The Triwizard Tournament", a magical tournament between three well-known schools of magic : Hogwarts, Beauxbatons, and Durmstrang. The contestants have to be above the age of seventeen, and are chosen by a magical object called "The Goblet of Fire". On the night of selection, however, the Goblet spews out four names instead of the usual three, with Harry unwittingly being selected as the Fourth Champion. Since the magic cannot be reversed, Harry is forced to go with it and brave three exceedingly ...
Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 13 wins & 43 nominations.
Stars: Daniel Radcliffe, Emma Watson, Rupert Grint, Eric Sykes
Companies: Warner Bros., Heyday Films, Patalex IV Productions Limited

Similars.Title: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Similars.FullTitle: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (2004)

Similars.Stars: Daniel Radcliffe, Emma Watson, Rupert Grint

Similars.Title: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
Similars.FullTitle: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix (2007)

Similars.Stars: Daniel Radcliffe, Emma Watson, Rupert Grint

Similars.Title: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
Similars.FullTitle: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (2002)

Similars.Stars: Daniel Radcliffe, Rupert Grint, Emma Watson

Similars.Title: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

Similars.Stars: Daniel Radcliffe, Emma Watson, Rupert Grint

Similars.Title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
Similars.FullTitle: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone (2001)
